actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend the laws relating to the Osage Tribe in Oklahoma.

summary.text: Provides that funds accruing to the Osage Indian Tribe of Oklahoma may be spent on programs beneficial to the tribe unless those funds are from (1) the Osage mineral estate or (2) judgments under the Indian Claims Commission Act. States that these funds that are ineligible for beneficial programs shall be placed in the U.S. Treasury for the credit of the Osage Indian Tribe and distributed to individual members of the tribe in the same manner as interest payments on money held in trust. Authorizes the use of unclaimed individual shares of funds restored to the tribe for the benefit of the tribe.

titles.title: A bill to amend the laws relating to the Osage Tribe in Oklahoma.
